alert.note: Alert for Cayuga; Seneca; Yates (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Binghamton (South Central New York and Northeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 05 at 7:07PM EDT by NWS Binghamton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central New York, including the following counties, Cayuga, Seneca and Yates. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 707 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported several roads closed due to flooding along with a few flooded basements in the advisory area due to thunderstorms. Additional Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Auburn, Seneca Falls, Waterloo, Penn Yan, Romulus, Sennett, Benton, Fleming, Ledyard, Potter, Middlesex, Union Springs, Italy, Aurora, Rushville, Ovid, Cayuga, Dresden, Kendaia and Willard. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
